title: 108_s1582
content: The Act may be cited as the "Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004" and includes amendments to the Valles Caldera Preservation Act. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 includes amendments regarding the acquisition of outstanding mineral interests by the Secretary with available funds. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 allows the Secretary to acquire interests if negotiations fail within 60 days. Any difference in compensation will be paid from a permanent judgment appropriation. Amendments also cover obligations and expenditures. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 allows the Trust to determine obligations and expenditures, and specifies who can solicit donations. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 allows the Trust to designate an executive position for soliciting donations and specifies the use of proceeds from activities on the Baca Ranch or the Preserve after October 27, 1999. SEC. 3. BOARD OF TRUSTEES. Section 107(e) of the Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to specify the selection and compensation of trustees, with the chair potentially receiving compensation at a determined rate not exceeding the annual pay rate for level IV of the Executive Schedule. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act amends Section 107(e) to outline the selection and compensation of trustees, with the chair's compensation capped at 25% of the annual pay rate for level IV of the Executive Schedule. SEC. 4. RESOURCE MANAGEMENT. Section 108(c)(3) of the Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to include limitations on property disposal by the Trust, excluding the sale of forage, forest products, or marketable renewable resources. Law enforcement and fire management provisions are also updated. Fire management services plan development and implementation on the Preserve are outlined in consultation with the Trust. The Secretary will provide services to the Trust under a cooperative agreement for fire management on the National Forest System. Reimbursable services may include presuppression and nonemergency rehabilitation and restoration. The Senate passed the bill on September 15, 2004. Attest: EMILY J. REYNOLDS, Secretary.
